sentences.sContent: They put an advertisement in ‘The Morning News’, offering a high salary for the right person.
sentences.sCn: 他们在《晨报》上刊登了一则启事，出高薪寻找合适的人选。

sentences.sContent: The organizers of the concert had taken out a full page advertisement in ‘The New York Times’.
sentences.sCn: 音乐会筹办者在《纽约时报》上刊登了整版广告。

sentences.sContent: Only a handful of people answered the advertisement .
sentences.sCn: 只有寥寥数人对该广告作出了回应。

words.tran: 广告客户；刊登广告的人
社论式广告（指常作为杂志中心插页的正式广告文字）
登广告（advertise的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: a picture, set of words, or a short film, which is intended to persuade people to buy a product or use a service, or that gives information about a job that is available, an event that is going to happen etc
